current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To prohibit the exercise of any waiver of the imposition of certain sanctions with respect to Iran
			 unless the President certifies to Congress that the waiver will not result
			 in the provision of funds to the Government of Iran for activities in
			 support of international terrorism, to develop nuclear weapons, or to
			 violate the human rights of the people of Iran.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Iranian Sanctions Relief Certification Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Iranian Sanctions Relief Certification Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Certification required for exercise of certain waivers of provisions of law imposing sanctions with
			 respect to Iran

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may not exercise a waiver
			 specified in

in connection with the extension of the terms
			 of the Joint Plan of Action beyond July 20, 2014, unless the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Iranian Sanctions Relief Certification Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
before the
			 waiver takes effect and every 60 days thereafter that any funds
			 made available to the Government of Iran as a result of the waiver will
			 not facilitate the ability of that Government—

text.#text: On and after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Office of
			 Foreign Assets Control of the Department of the Treasury

text.#text:
any individual or entity designated for the imposition of sanctions for activities relating to
			 international terrorism pursuant to an Executive order or by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: as a foreign terrorist organization under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 219(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

text.#text:
to advance the efforts of Iran or any other country to develop nuclear weapons or ballistic
			 missiles overtly or covertly; or
to commit any violation of the human rights of the people of Iran.
A waiver specified in this subsection is any of the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to the imposition of sanctions under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1245/ss:d/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to the imposition of
			 sanctions under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
paragraph (5) of section 1245(d) of the National Defense Authorization
			 Act for Fiscal Year 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2012/s:1245/ss:d/p:5
Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012/s:302/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to the identification of foreign
			 persons under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection (e) of section 302 of the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria
			 Human Rights Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012/s:302/ss:e
Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012/s:1244/ss:c

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to the imposition of
			 sanctions under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
subsection (i) of section 1244 of the Iran Freedom and
			 Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Iran Freedom and Counter-Proliferation Act of 2012/s:1244/ss:i

term.#tail:
means the Joint Plan of Action, signed at Geneva November 24, 2013, by Iran and by France,
			 Germany, the Russian Federation, the People's Republic of China, the
			 United Kingdom, and the United States.
